description: A complete end‑to‑end conversation where a shareholder uploads a shareholders' agreement, the system extracts the text, parses key clauses (voting rights, tag‑along, drag‑along, forced buy‑out), generates plain‑language summaries, flags risky forced‑buy‑out language, and provides a downloadable markdown briefing.

messages.content: You are ClauseClear, an AI‑powered legal contract summarizer. Help users understand contracts by extracting clauses, summarizing them in plain language, flagging risks, and exporting a concise briefing.
I’ve got a shareholders' agreement I need to review. Could you summarize the voting rights, tag‑along/drag‑along provisions, and tell me if there are any risky forced‑buy‑out clauses?
Sure! Please upload the PDF of the shareholders' agreement and I’ll get started.
Extracting the text from the uploaded PDF...

"1. Voting Rights. Each Shareholder shall have one vote per share held. Decisions on major matters require a supermajority of 75% of the voting shares.

2. Tag‑Along Right. If any Shareholder proposes to sell more than 25% of its shares, the other Shareholders have the right to join the sale on the same terms.

3. Drag‑Along Right. If Shareholders holding at least 70% of the shares approve a sale of the Company, the remaining Shareholders must sell their shares on the same terms.

4. Forced Buy‑Out. The Company may force the purchase of any Shareholder's shares if that Shareholder breaches any material obligation, at a price determined by a mutually agreed independent valuator."
Parsing the contract to identify the key clauses...

summaries.summary_text: Voting Rights: Each shareholder gets one vote per share, and major company decisions need at least 75% of the voting shares to pass.
Tag‑Along Right: If a shareholder wants to sell more than 25% of their shares, the other shareholders can join the sale and sell on the same terms.
Drag‑Along Right: If shareholders holding at least 70% of the company approve a sale, the remaining shareholders must also sell their shares on the same terms.

risk_flags.explanation: The company can force a purchase of a shareholder's shares on a price set by an independent valuator, which may be unfavorable to the shareholder if no caps or board approval are required.
risk_flags.mitigation: Negotiate a price cap or require that any forced buy‑out be approved by a supermajority of the other shareholders, and define a clear valuation methodology with a floor price.

messages.content:
Here’s your concise briefing:

- **Voting Rights** – each shareholder gets one vote per share; major decisions need a 75% supermajority.
- **Tag‑Along Right** – shareholders can join a sale of more than 25% of another’s shares on the same terms.
- **Drag‑Along Right** – if shareholders holding ≥70% approve a sale, the rest must also sell on those terms.

**Risk Flag**
- *Forced Buy‑Out*: The company can compel a purchase of a shareholder’s shares after a breach, with price set by an independent valuator. Consider negotiating a price cap or requiring super‑majority board approval.

You can download the full markdown report here: https://clauseclear.com/downloads/briefing_98765.md
